comments.body: Maybe this could use `self.restheaders = connection_header.header` to avoid changing all the calls bellow to `headers=self.restheaders.header`. Especially since I don't think the object's other fields are used again.

I give the whole object in order to use the `refresh_token` later.

But as I think about it, it seems useless, because the token is generated at the beginning of every module.

No I don't use the other fields after. I think a function is enough.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +116,120 @@        self.baseurl = self.module.params.get('auth_keycloak_url')
        self.validate_certs = self.module.params.get('validate_certs')
        self.restheaders = connection_header

    def get_clients(self, realm='master', filter=None):
